title.value: Dynamic Shimming in the Cervical Spinal Cord for Multi-Echo Gradient-Echo Imaging at 3 T
title.justification: This is the title of the paper as provided by the user.
title.quote: Dynamic Shimming in the Cervical Spinal Cord for Multi-Echo Gradient-Echo Imaging at 3 T

extractions.description: This study focuses on enhancing the imaging quality of the cervical spinal cord using MRI at 3 Tesla by implementing dynamic shimming techniques. The primary aim is to correct magnetic field inhomogeneities that cause image artifacts by employing a novel approach termed realtime dynamic shimming. The study replicates prior work on z-shimming and introduces improvements by incorporating in-plane compensation gradients to address respiration-induced magnetic field variations.

type.justification: The research involves human participants and experimental validation, including acquisitions of MRI scans, the implementation of new imaging sequences, and the analysis of image quality improvements.
type.quote: Measurements performed in a group of 12 healthy volunteers at 3 T show improved signal homogeneity along the spinal cord when using z-shimming.

name.justification: The paper's main focus is on improving MRI imaging techniques for the spinal cord.
name.quote: The aim of this study is two-fold. The first aim was to replicate aspects of a previous study wherein z-shimming was found to improve image quality in T2*-weighted echo-planar imaging.

name.justification: The specific imaging technology discussed and enhanced in the paper is MRI.
name.quote: Obtaining high quality images of the spinal cord with MRI is difficult, partly due to the fact that the spinal cord is surrounded by a number of structures that have differing magnetic susceptibility.

name.justification: The study involves methods to correct signal inhomogeneities caused by magnetic field variations.
name.quote: Shimming is commonly achieved by measuring ΔB0, and subsequently decomposing the ΔB0 distribution into a set of spherical harmonic basis functions.
